Also, am I the only one who had no idea that Proxima Centauri is actually part of the Alpha Centauri system? (Yes, Proxima does orbit very far around Alpha A and

The best place to go for exoplanet news is the Systemic blog, and they don't disappoint for this story.

Reading that post should give everybody a good idea of why it took us so long to spot this planet. It's not easy work.

Oh God PANDORA?

Strictly speaking no - Pandora was a moon of a gas giant. And while we have yet to discover an extrasolar moon, if you're looking for Pandora I would like to point you to Kepler-47, which has a gas giant in the habitable zone, and could potentially be host to a moon with an atmosphere, liquid water, aliens and what have you.
